article_title: NC paying for AIDS drugs for residents insured under ACA
article_text: The NC Department of Health and Human Services is now paying for drug coverage for HIV-positive residents who have insurance coverage through the Affordable Care Act. The agency has quietly launched the Insurance Copay Assistance Program to pay for AIDS medications – which can cost more than $2,000 a month – for qualifying residents.

article_summary:
The NC Department of Health and Human Services is now paying for drug coverage for HIV-positive residents who have insurance coverage through the Affordable Care Act.
The agency has quietly launched the Insurance Copay Assistance Program to pay for AIDS medications – which can cost more than $2,000 a month – for qualifying residents.
